title: How to Make a Duct Tape Squishy

steps.headline: Shape the sponge.
steps.description: Use a scissor and trim the pieces little by little to make the shape you want. Trim your sponge slowly and patiently; you can always cut off more, but you can't undo whatever you cut off. If you are using a dish sponge, take off the rough green part before you start trimming it.

steps.headline: Wrap the tape.
steps.description: Take the duct tape and wrap it piece by piece until you cover the whole thing. Make sure you cover all the air holes; that way it will be a better slow-rising squishy. If you're not happy with the texture, keep adding layers of duct tape to your satisfaction.

steps.headline: Take two pieces of duct tape, then stick them together sideways.
steps.description: You can use any colour of tape for this. Make sure the sticky side of the tape is facing you. Make one more and stick the second one on top of the first one. Make one more of this.

steps.headline: Draw any desired shape of your squishy on it, then place it on top of the other one to make them the same size.
steps.description: When you cut them, stick them using tape and leave space to put in the filling. When you leave space, make sure it's big enough to fit stuffing in it.

steps.headline: Put your stuffing in the squishy.
steps.description: Take the cotton and put it in the squishy until its full. After you stuff it, tape the hole and you have your squishy! You can use different kinds of cotton; they include cotton of toy stuffing and cotton balls. You can decorate your squishy with permanent markers.

text: Creating the Sponge Filling Shape the sponge. Use a scissor and trim the pieces little by little to make the shape you want. Trim your sponge slowly and patiently; you can always cut off more, but you can't undo whatever you cut off. If you are using a dish sponge, take off the rough green part before you start trimming it. Wrap the tape. Take the duct tape and wrap it piece by piece until you cover the whole thing. Make sure you cover all the air holes; that way it will be a better slow-rising squishy. If you're not happy with the texture, keep adding layers of duct tape to your satisfaction. Making the Cotton Filling Take two pieces of duct tape, then stick them together sideways. You can use any colour of tape for this. Make sure the sticky side of the tape is facing you. Make one more and stick the second one on top of the first one. Make one more of this. Draw any desired shape of your squishy on it, then place it on top of the other one to make them the same size. When you cut them, stick them using tape and leave space to put in the filling. When you leave space, make sure it's big enough to fit stuffing in it. Put your stuffing in the squishy. Take the cotton and put it in the squishy until its full. After you stuff it, tape the hole and you have your squishy! You can use different kinds of cotton; they include cotton of toy stuffing and cotton balls. You can decorate your squishy with permanent markers.
